algorithm.explanation: Binary Search is a searching algorithm that works on sorted arrays by repeatedly dividing the search interval in half. It efficiently finds the target value by comparing it to the middle element of the array and adjusting the search interval accordingly.

inputs.name: target
inputs.description: Target value to find in the array

metaphors.name: Binary Search in Library
metaphors.description: Imagine searching for a book in a well-organized library with books sorted in ascending order of their ID numbers.
steps: Start at the middle of the library
Check the ID of the book in the middle
If it matches the target, you found the book
If the target is smaller, look in the left half of the library
If the target is larger, look in the right half of the library
Repeat the process until the book is found or all books are checked
